result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Introduce Defendant's Statements.
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Certified Public Records without Extrinsic Evidence.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim T.O (person, property, residence or family). No contact with Wind Point apartments. No contact with 420 three mile rd.

1:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael D Canady appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Michael D Canady. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
